observatory.title: Observatory
observatory.description: Find patterns in your text. We'll help you discover interesting patterns in your writing.
observatory.try_examples: Try these examples to get started
observatory.input_placeholder: Enter your text here to discover its patterns...
observatory.pattern_found: I found some interesting patterns! Take a look at what I found.
observatory.ready: Welcome to the Observatory! What patterns should we find today?
observatory.instructions: Enter any English textâ€”like song lyrics, a poem, or a phrase you're practicingâ€”to see how its sounds create rhythm and flow. This is a powerful tool for improving your pronunciation.
observatory.howItWorksDescription: We analyze the phonetic structure of your text. After analysis, click on words in the text or patterns in the legend on the right. This bidirectional exploration helps you connect written words to their spoken sounds, improving your accent and flow.
observatory.hover_for_details: Hover over a pattern to see details
observatory.shareToPost: Create a post to share this observation

feedback.title: Report Observatory Issue
feedback.description: Help us improve the Observatory by letting us know if it's working for you.
feedback.submitError: Failed to submit feedback. Please try again.

observatory.text_cleaned: Text cleaned - removed metadata and formatting for better analysis
observatory.subtitle: Observe the hidden patterns in text through the lens of sound and meaning
observatory.textPlaceholder: Enter text here to observe its phonetic patterns...

analysis.noPatterns: No patterns found in the current text.

rhyme.title: End Rhyme
rhyme.description: Words that share similar ending sounds, creating musical harmony in the text.

slant_rhyme.title: Slant Rhyme
slant_rhyme.description: Words with similar but not identical sounds, creating subtle sonic connections.

internal_rhyme.title: Internal Rhyme
internal_rhyme.description: Rhyming words within the same line or nearby lines.
internal_rhyme.example: I cry and sigh in the twilight sky

assonance.title: Assonance
assonance.description: Repetition of similar vowel sounds within words, creating internal melody.

consonance.title: Consonance
consonance.description: Repetition of consonant sounds, often creating texture in the text.

alliteration.title: Alliteration
alliteration.description: Repetition of initial consonant sounds in nearby words.

sibilance.title: Sibilance
sibilance.description: Repetition of 's' and 'sh' sounds, creating a hushing or whistling effect.

plosive.title: Plosive Sounds
plosive.description: Repetition of explosive consonants (p, b, t, d, k, g), adding percussive effects.

liquid_consonants.title: Liquid Consonants
liquid_consonants.description: Repetition of flowing sounds (l, r), creating smooth, fluid effects.

nasal_consonants.title: Nasal Consonants
nasal_consonants.description: Repetition of nasal sounds (m, n, ng), adding resonance.

rhythm.title: Rhythmic Pattern
rhythm.description: Regular patterns of stressed and unstressed syllables creating a musical beat.

meter.title: Metrical Pattern
meter.description: Specific arrangements of stressed and unstressed syllables in formal patterns.

caesura.title: Caesura
caesura.description: Natural pauses or breaks in the rhythm, creating emphasis or pacing.
caesura.example: The woods are lovely || dark and deep

enjambment.title: Enjambment
enjambment.description: Continuation of a sentence beyond the line break, creating flow and tension.
enjambment.example:
The morning light
breaks through clouds

parallelism.title: Sound Parallelism
parallelism.description: Similar sound patterns repeated in parallel structures.

onomatopoeia.title: Onomatopoeia
onomatopoeia.description: Words that phonetically imitate the sound they describe.

euphony.title: Euphony
euphony.description: Harmonious combination of sounds that are pleasing to the ear.

cacophony.title: Cacophony
cacophony.description: Harsh or discordant sound combinations for dramatic effect.

generic.description: A recurring sound pattern in the text.

end_rhyme.name: End Rhyme
end_rhyme.explanation: Matching sounds at the ends of words or lines

internal_rhyme.name: Internal Rhyme
internal_rhyme.explanation: Rhyming words within the same line

vowel_harmony.name: Vowel Harmony
vowel_harmony.explanation: Similar vowel sounds creating melodic unity

consonant_harmony.name: Consonant Harmony
consonant_harmony.explanation: Similar consonant sounds creating textural unity

stress_pattern.name: Stress Pattern
stress_pattern.explanation: Regular arrangement of stressed and unstressed syllables

sound_quality.name: Sound Quality
sound_quality.explanation: The acoustic characteristics of the sounds (smooth, harsh, etc.)

sound_position.name: Sound Position
sound_position.explanation: Where the repeated sounds occur in words

sound_frequency.name: Sound Frequency
sound_frequency.explanation: How often the sound pattern appears

sound_intensity.name: Sound Intensity
sound_intensity.explanation: The strength or prominence of the sound pattern

sound_relationship.name: Sound Relationship
sound_relationship.explanation: How different sound patterns interact or complement each other

generic.explanation: A distinctive sound feature in the text

what_is_noctua.question: What is Noctua Forest?
what_is_noctua.answer: Noctua Forest is a unique platform for discovering and understanding patterns in text. Like an owl observing the forest at night, it helps you see the hidden patterns in your writing, from rhymes to subtle sound relationships.

how_to_observe.question: How do I make an observation?
how_to_observe.answer:
To make an observation:
1. Enter your text in the Observatory
2. Click 'Begin Observation'
3. Explore the patterns that Noctua discovers
4. Click on patterns to see detailed explanations

pattern_types.question: What types of patterns can Noctua find?
pattern_types.answer:
Noctua can identify several types of sound patterns:
- Rhymes (end rhymes and internal rhymes)
- Assonance (repeated vowel sounds)
- Consonance (repeated consonant sounds)
- Alliteration (repeated initial sounds)
- Rhythmic patterns (stress patterns)

batch_processing.question: Can I analyze multiple texts at once?
batch_processing.answer: Yes! You can use batch processing to analyze multiple texts simultaneously. This feature is perfect for comparing patterns across different pieces or processing a collection of texts efficiently.

save_observations.question: Can I save my observations?
save_observations.answer:
Yes, you can save your observations to your profile. This allows you to:
- Build a collection of analyzed texts
- Track patterns over time
- Share observations with others
- Export your findings

flowFinder.title: Flow Finder
flowFinder.gameInstructions: Click on words to reveal patterns. Avoid clicking on mines! Find all patterns to win.
flowFinder.failed: Challenge failed! You hit a mine:
flowFinder.instruction1: Your goal is to find all the pattern words in the text without hitting any mines.
flowFinder.instruction2: Click on words to reveal them. Pattern words will be highlighted in different colors.
flowFinder.instruction3: Avoid clicking on mine words - they will end the game immediately!
flowFinder.instruction4: Find all pattern words within the time limit to win tokens and XP.
flowFinder.warning: Be careful! Some words are mines that will end the game.

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.introduction: Welcome to Noctua Forest. These Terms of Service govern your use of our platform. By accessing or using Noctua Forest, you agree to be bound by these terms.

acceptance.title: Acceptance of Terms
acceptance.content: By creating an account or using our services, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree to be bound by these Terms of Service and our Privacy Policy.

service.title: Description of Service
service.content: Noctua Forest provides pattern observation and learning services, including:
service.observatory: The Observatory - Text pattern analysis and visualization
service.lessons: Interactive lessons on pattern recognition and creation
service.community: Community features for sharing and discovering patterns
service.storage: Storage and organization of your observations

ai.title: AI-Powered Services
ai.content: Our pattern analysis uses artificial intelligence. You should understand that:
ai.analysis: AI analysis may not always be 100% accurate
ai.ownership: You retain ownership of all content you submit
ai.accuracy: We strive for accuracy but cannot guarantee perfection
ai.improvement: Your usage helps improve our AI models

conduct.title: User Conduct
conduct.content: When using Noctua Forest, you agree to:
conduct.respect: Treat all users with respect and kindness
conduct.legal: Use the service only for lawful purposes
conduct.security: Not attempt to breach our security measures

intellectual.title: Intellectual Property
intellectual.content: You retain all rights to content you create. By using our service, you grant us a license to process and display your content as necessary to provide our services. Our platform, including the Observatory and lesson content, is protected by intellectual property laws.

changes.title: Changes to Terms
changes.content: We may update these terms from time to time. We will notify you of significant changes via email or through the platform. Continued use after changes constitutes acceptance.

contact.title: Contact Information
contact.content: If you have questions about these terms, please contact our legal team.

agreement.title: Your Agreement
agreement.content: By using Noctua Forest, you confirm that you have read and agree to these Terms of Service.

privacy.deletion_description: Permanently delete your account and all associated data. This action cannot be undone.
privacy.deletion_warning: This will delete all your learning progress, observations, and account data within 30 days.
privacy.deletion_details: Deleting your account will permanently remove:

deletion_list.observations: â€¢ Pattern observations and saved content

privacy.deletion_confirmation_prompt: To confirm deletion, please type "DELETE" in the field below:

deletion.success: Your account and data have been scheduled for deletion within 30 days.
deletion.error: Failed to process deletion request. Please contact support.
